revised_title: The Hydrolysis of Cane Sugar by Sulphuric Acid: A Study of the Processes Operative in Solutions
tldr: This study investigates the hydrolysis of cane sugar by sulphuric acid and explores the effects of varying concentrations on the process. The research also examines the influence of molecular hydration and optical rotation on the reaction, providing insights into the complexities of the hydrolytic process.
